title: Ticket #6069: DAG status file is wrong if all submit attempts fail for final node
description:
(See the job_dagman_final-K test.)

All submit attempts fail for the final node, but the DAG status file has a final status of 

  DagStatus = 3; /* "STATUS_SUBMITTED ()" */
remarks:
2017-May-18 17:01:00 by coatsworth:
It turns out this problem wasn't limited to Final nodes, it affected regular nodes also. If the last node in a DAG failed to submit, condor_dagman would exit before realizing the status file was outdated.

I've added a very simple fix, flagging the status file for update after submit failures. This could go in any number of places; let me know if the method I chose makes sense.

Also I figured this should go into 8.6 instead of 8.7 since it's a bug fix. Hope that sounds okay.

My code in the V8_6-gt6069-dag-status-final-fails branch.

2017-May-23 12:51:26 by wenger:
CODE REVIEW

The code looks fine.

A couple of things:

  • There should be a version history item documenting that the bug got fixed.
  • You should fix the job_dagman_final-K test (just change it to look for DagStatus = 6), uncomment it in CMakeLists.txt, and run a build/test on all platforms.

2017-May-23 12:55:03 by wenger:
Oh, yeah -- note that I changed "fixed version" to v080604, so this should get merged into the 8.6 branch, and, obviously, the version history entry should go into 8.6.

2017-Jun-13 15:44:55 by coatsworth:
I've added the test, and updated the documentation as requested by Kent. Ran a build and test on batlab, everything seems to work fine.

My RHEL 7 system can't test making the documentation due to some compatibility errors, however I tried running a `make local.html` on a batlab submit machine and it went fine. So I think we're good here.

2017-Jun-13 16:39:09 by tim:
CODE REVIEW: Looks safe and effective.

2017-Jun-13 16:41:00 by tim:
DOC REVIEW: complete
